channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11437] Modify cell tag handling code to treat the length as unsigned
item.description: We store each tag's length and total tags length with 2 bytes in KeyValue buffer, HFiles etc and we treat these lengths as short through out the code. So the max length can be Short.MAX_VALUE. We can treat these lengths as unsigned and +ve always. So we can actually treat these lengths as int and store with 2 bytes so that the max length can reach 65535.
item.summary: Modify cell tag handling code to treat the length as unsigned

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: IMO, Cell#getTagsLength() can be kept as deprecated in 0.98.x and 0.99 and can be removed from master (2.0.0). What do you say?

Cell#getTagsLength() can be kept as deprecated in 0.98.x and 0.99 and can be removed from master (2.0.0). What do you say?

+1

+1

IMO, Cell#getTagsLength() can be kept as deprecated in 0.98.x and 0.99 and can be removed from master (2.0.0). What do you say?

Another option would be to deprecate both 'short Cell#getTagsLength' and 'int Cell#getTagsLengthUnsigned' in 0.98 and 0.99 and for 2.0.0 replace both with 'int Cell#getTagsLength'. Thus, in trunk we replace a short return type with an int and keep a reasonable method name, while respecting deprecation convention. What do you think?
By mistake one line removal in Tag caused the tests to fail. This should fix it.

Another option would be to deprecate both 'short Cell#getTagsLength' and 'int Cell#getTagsLengthUnsigned' in 0.98 and 0.99 and for 2.0.0 replace both with 'int Cell#getTagsLength'. Thus, in trunk we replace a short return type with an int and keep a reasonable method name, while respecting deprecation convention. What do you think?

That will make the API clean in trunk atleast. Only thing is this will leave 98 and 1.0.0 with 2 deprecated APIs in Cell with out any replacements available there. That will be bit strange no?

That will make the API clean in trunk atleast. Only thing is this will leave 98 and 1.0.0 with 2 deprecated APIs in Cell with out any replacements available there. That will be bit strange no?

Yes it will be a bit strange, but that's our fault for using a 'short' return in the first place. Cell#getTagsLengthUnsigned won't be a meaningful method name in 2.0+.

That TestImportTSVWithVisibilityLabels zombie could be a real issue. Can you reproduce it locally?

Trunk patch which replaces
short getTagsLength() with
int getTagsLength()

Andrew Purtell Can we get this in for 0.98.4 itself. My initial plan was to make it for 0.98.5 only. Now the 0.98.4 RC cut got delayed due to other issues.

Can we get this in for 0.98.4 itself.

+1, updated the fix version
The patch looks good to me. The latest patch is lesser in size than the older ones. Hope all the places are changed. +1

The latest patch is lesser in size than the older ones. Hope all the places are changed

Yes all places. This is because in latest trunk patch we have not renamed the method but changed the signature (as we discussed for the deprecation). So it is not touching many files where the change was only method name change.

0.98 and branch-1 versions of patch (With deprecation of API in Cell)
Ping Enis Soztutar for commit to branch-1
This needs to be in place for the 0.98 and RM confirmed. So this will be very much needed in branch-1 as well.. Pls review.

Another option would be to deprecate both 'short Cell#getTagsLength' and 'int Cell#getTagsLengthUnsigned' in 0.98 and 0.99 and for 2.0.0 replace both with 'int Cell#getTagsLength'. Thus, in trunk we replace a short return type with an int and keep a reasonable method name, while respecting deprecation convention. What do you think?

This seems strange to me. If an application program wants to use this and compile against both 1.x line and 2.x line, then there is no correct way to use the API. I think trunk patch should include the Cell#getTagsLengthUnsigned() signature with deprecated annotation so that users can switch. Also can you please add a javadoc for the methods explaining the reason for deprecating, and which API they should use for which version.
Otherwise +1 for branch-1.

This seems strange to me. If an application program wants to use this and compile against both 1.x line and 2.x line, then there is no correct way to use the API

Ok, then how about deprecation of getTagsLengthUnsigned in 0.98 with Javadoc indicating the upcoming change to getTagsLength in 1.0 and later. Would like to relegate the error of using a short return to the scrapheap rather than carry it into later release lines.
I think I like that better, which will be cleaner. getTagsLength() should not be very commonly used given that it is new, so a one time hit from 0.98 -> 1.0 should be ok I guess.

I think I like that better, which will be cleaner.

Cool, let's do that. What do you think Anoop Sam John ?

Sounds good to me Andy. Let me make the changes then.

That means same kind of trunk patch for branch-1 also. And the attached trunk patch applies to branch-1 also. I will add the doc about the change in API name in the 0.98 patch.
Pushed to 0.98+ branches. Thanks for the reviews.
